intro: Hieracium lima, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, while its stems are hairy and erect. Hieracium lima is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
